comments.body: Thanks Jonah! Added tests around the git cli throwing issues.
Stylistically, I prefer named args when there are more than 1 arg. However, I don't see any guidance from effective dart on this. Thoughts?
not sure about official guidance, i'll just add in the flutter tool, we prefer named args when there are 3 or more

1) does this run with asserts enabled?
2) in what order do we land this (and the related PRs)?
3) does this flag need to be passed in from both the recipe and the cocoon agent?

1. The tests will, which checks the calls to this . However, runtime issues can still happen regarding flags. I was under the assumption NNBD was being used by the test runner, is it not?
2. This lands first, then the recipes CL
3. No. It's only used on LUCI runs. Cocoon agent handles this logic in the agent

2. what will the value of `gitBranch` be if it is not passed as a command-line option? My concern is just that we fail with a helpful error if somehow this method gets invoked with an invalid `gitBranch` value.
shall we have `gitBranch` with a default value like HEAD?
Oh, the `HEAD` causes the error.. nvm..

I moved the error checking into cocoon with https://github.com/flutter/cocoon/pull/1022

This will give a more descriptive error than we can do in the test runner.
